00017 using namespace std;

00019 bool keywordFor(MavenCompiler* c, string line, string& close) {
00020         int actionStart;
00021         string question = getStatementQuestion(line, actionStart);
00022         StringList qp = split(';', question);
00023         
00024         if(qp.length() != 3) {
00025                 pushError(c, "Incomplete for statement");
00026                 return false;
00027         }
00028         
00029         StringList type;
00030         MavenMutability mut;
00031         StringList tokens = split(' ', trim(qp[0]));
00032         string init = "";
00033         if(tokens.length() > 0) {
00034                 MavenVariable v;
00035                 
00036                 // look for a type
00037                 if(isDataType(tokens[0]) || objectExists(c, tokens[0]) || enumExists(c, tokens[0])) {
00038                         v.type = tokens[0];
00039                         v.name = tokens[1];
00040                         init = v.type + " " + v.name;
00041                         if(tokens.length() > 2)
00042                                 init += string(" = ") + dissectCode(c, trim(tokens.join(" ", 3, tokens.length() - 1)), type, mut);
00043                 } else init = dissectCode(c, trim(qp[0]), type, mut);
00044                 
00045                 pushLocalScope(c, v);
00046         }
00047         
00048         // bug #28: check that the 'middle part' of the 'for' is a boolean or number type
00049         string cpp = "for(" + init;
00050         cpp += "; " + dissectCode(c, trim(qp[1]), type, mut);
00051         cpp += "; " + dissectCode(c, trim(qp[2]), type, mut) + "){";
00052         
00053         // bug #29: needs to count '()' brackets
00054         cpp += dissectCode(c, trim(line.substr(line.find(')', question.length()) + 1)), type, mut) + ";";
00055         
00056         // closure
00057         close = "}/*for*/" + close;
00058         
00059         // !C003
00060         writeAutoCPPLine(c, objectCheckCPP(c));
00061         writeAutoCPPLine(c, cpp);
00062         
00063         return true;
00064 }
